question: Who was the poor man?
What was the habit of Iena?
answer1: roaming about from place to place

question: What did Iena often wish for?
answer1: a companion to share his solitude

question: Why did Iena think no one would be his companion?
answer1: No one would think of joining their fortunes with those of a poor wanderer.
answer2: Iena had no shelter but such as his leather hunting-shirt provided.
answer3: Iena had no other household in the world than the bundle which he carried in his hand, and in which his hunting-shirt was laid away.

question: What happened after Iena went out in quest of game?
answer1: Iena found a small but neat lodge built in the place where he had left his bundle.

question: Who did Iena see sitting on the further side of the lodge?
What did Iena do during the day?
What happened after Iena left the game to Night-Hawk?
answer1: Iena took up his bundle and departed.

question: How did Iena feel when he saw the woman?
What happened to the woman after she ran out to look at the deer?
answer1: stumbled and fell at the threshold

question: How did Iena feel about the day's hunt?
What did Iena do when he entered the lodge?
What did Iena catch the woman doing?
answer1: greedily eating all the fat of the deer

question: What did the woman do when Iena entered the lodge?
answer2: brought in the deer, cut it up as it should be, and hung up the meat to dry

question: What did Iena continue to do every day?
How did Iena feel living with the woman?

What did the woman do while Iena went in quest of game?
answer2: used magic to build a lodge

question: Why did Iena believe he was blessed?
answer1: There was a lodge where his bundle was.

question: What will happen when Iena suspends his bundle again?
answer3: Iena will prosper in his hunt.

question: How will Iena feel about the woman eating the fat of the deer?

answer2: She was already eating the fat of the deer.

question: Why did Iena say he was certainly blessed with the third woman?
answer2: She prepared the deer for him.
